summary: The Working Families Tax Cut Act, H.R. 1833, amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. It renames the standard deduction as the 'guaranteed deduction' and makes corresponding changes throughout the code. It also introduces a bonus guaranteed deduction for the 2026 and 2027 tax years, varying based on filing status, alongside provisions for inflation adjustments and income-based limitations. These changes aim to provide additional tax relief to working families.
